intro: Moehringia intermedia, commonly known as the common moehringia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 5 to 15 centimeters. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces tiny, clustered flowers in shades of pink to purple. It is native to regions of Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Moehringia intermedia is adapted to dry environments and is often used in ornamental gardening for its delicate appearance.
